_comment: Created by JMorris on 15/02/2018 14:40:58 using v2.7
title: What proportion of adults with learning disabilities live in their own home or with their family?
analysis_commentary:
The proportion of adults aged 18-64 with a learning disability who live in their own home or with their family increased from 70% in 2011-12 to 76.2% in 2016-17. In 2016-17 there were 99,193 adults receiving long-term disability support who were living in their own home or with their family in England.

Updated January 2018.
data_source: NHS Digital, Adult Social Care Outcomes Framework
